div.p: Here is our Monday Video Announcement – hope you enjoy!
Announcements for today are mostly review since we’ve had a few days between communications. These came out toward the end of last week and over the weekend, so please take a minute to review them.

ul.li: Here is a document with important info about workload, grading, schedule, etc. Please give it a read and let me know if you have any questions - NCUHS Remote Learning Guidance.
Attendance: You probably already know this, but based on the feedback we received, we changed the attendance from email to Google Classroom, which should be easier for everyone.

The senior steering committee will be meeting on Wednesday and we are hoping to have some ideas ready to share by the end of the week – stay tuned; we’re working hard to find ways to celebrate the end of the year.

Dates: In case you missed it, we have some news on end of the year dates. We hope that the incentive to end a little bit earlier will help our students focus for the next few weeks and do the best that they can to get the work done.
May 29th – Seniors last day (senior make-up work June 1st – 5th with no exams)
June 5th – Last day for grades 9-11 (make-up work June 8th-12th with no exams)

div.p: That’s it for today – let me know if you have any questions!
Good afternoon Falcons and welcome back from vacation!

We just wanted to make you aware of a change to the attendance procedure beginning on Monday. Some of you are already aware of this change but for those who are not, we are making an effort to make life easier for everyone when it comes to taking attendance. We have created a Google Classroom for each of the classes: Freshmen, Sophomores, Juniors and Seniors. Tina will make sure you get a daily reminder via email, just like you were before, however, instead of having to respond or send a read receipt, you can just check in to the Attendance Google Classroom and let her know you are present. Done. We are hoping this will be easier for you since you already use Google Classroom for your other subjects. Everything will all be in one place.

We understand that this method may not be ideal for all students. For those students who do not access Google Classroom due to issues with access, or those who are more comfortable using the original system put in place, please continue to respond to Tina as you were originally doing. We are simply trying to utilize more avenues to capture as much attendance as possible since it is a requirement of the State.

We are not trying to throw more changes at you. There have been way too many of those in recent months. Hopefully this makes things a little easier for everyone. See the attached screenshots & instructions to help you. If you have questions, please let Tina or myself know.

p.strong: Please check out the new NCUHS SlideShow for information on what is happening at School.

p.a: If on a mobile device, tap this link to open the slideshow in a new tab.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OwsYgb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: NKHS has established a NKHS Parent Support Line. They have a phone number now dedicated to this community service and they will be doing a "Cold Start" today from 8:30AM-5:00PM. This will be available Monday through Friday 8:30-5:00 until they increase to 24/7 schedule. The plan is to be ready to provide 24/7 coverage.
This line is a dedicated warm line for parents and guardians to access when having difficulty managing their children’s behaviors at home. It is staffed by NKHS’s Children’s Department clinicians.
Feel free to give the number to your families for support in managing children's behaviors starting Friday April 3, 2020 at 8:30AM- 5:00 pm and during the work week.

p.strong: NKHS Behavior Support Line 749-1111 (no 802 needed if calling from Vermont)

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.small: North Country Supervisory Union (NCSU) provides educational opportunities without regard to race, color, national origin, sex, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital/civil union status, or any other characteristic protected by Federal or State law. NCSU provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. For questions regarding this policy please contact: Leanne Desjardins 802-334-5847 ext. 2022 or Richard Smith 802-334-5847 ext. 2028
